intro: Stigmaphyllon jatrophifolium f. gracile, commonly known as the slender-stemmed stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, palmate leaves with a distinctive veining pattern. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky soils.
